p: ASFV is stable under extreme environmental conditions, allowing it to be easily spread and transmitted. Modes of transmission other than direct contact with infected swine, tissues, carcasses or bites from infected soft ticks, include importation of infected pork products and contamination of fomites such as feed, equipment, vehicles, and clothing ( 22). ASFV can remain viable in a variety of animal feed ingredients under a range of environmental conditions, including those characteristic of trans-Atlantic shipping routes ( 67, 68), and efficient disease transmission through ASFV-contaminated liquids and plant-based animal feeds has been experimentally demonstrated ( 69). The movement of contaminated pork products and swill-feeding of domestic swine have been important epidemiological factors in ASFV outbreaks in the Caucasus and Russian Federation as well as the emergence of the disease in China ( 9, 11).
